commentary_data: Squad: Wriddhiman Saha(w), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya(c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Rashid Khan, Alzarri Joseph, Mohammed Shami, Mohit Sharma, Joshua Little, Vijay Shankar, Shivam Mavi, Jayant Yadav, Abhinav Manohar, Srikar Bharat, Pradeep Sangwan, Matthew Wade, Dasun Shanaka, Odean Smith, Ravisrinivasan Sai Kishore, Yash Dayal, Darshan Nalkande, Urvil Patel, Noor Ahmad

Squad: Yashasvi Jaiswal, Jos Buttler, Sanju Samson(w/c), Devdutt Padikkal, Shimron Hetmyer, Dhruv Jurel, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jason Holder, Kuldeep Sen, Sandeep Sharma, Yuzvendra Chahal, Riyan Parag, Donavon Ferreira, KM Asif, Adam Zampa, Joe Root, Trent Boult, Murugan Ashwin, Navdeep Saini, Akash Vasisht, KC Cariappa, Obed McCoy, Kuldip Yadav, Abdul Basith, Kunal Singh Rathore

The weekend is about to end but there's a mouth-watering encounter coming up. Hello everyone and a warm welcome to Super Sunday's second game. It's the finalists of the previous edition. It's the clash between two in-form teams that have won three of their four matches. It's Gujarat Titans up against Rajasthan Royals at the beautiful Narendra Modi Stadium.

are currently placed third on the points table and have hardly put a foot wrong this season. Their chasing record just keeps getting better and better with every game. Yes, they won the last game with only one ball to spare but they were in total control of the proceedings. If not for that once-in-a-lifetime innings from Rinku Singh, the defending champions would have had a 100% win record this season. Hardik and Co. won't be tinkering with their successful combination.

too don't have too many chinks in their armour. Unlike GT, all of RR's win have come while batting first with Jos Buttler and Yashasvi Jaiswal doing the bulk of the scoring. Hetmyer too has been striking the ball really well lower down the order. In the bowling department, their three experienced bowlers - Boult, Ashwin and Chahal - have been amongst the wickets. Sandeep Sharma's confidence should be sky-high too after defending I0$ against MSD and Jadeja. The Royals have the best NRR (+1.588), courtesy two big wins. Can they consolidate their position at the top of the table? Let's find out....

Square boundaries 66 m both side, straight 74 m. It's the same pitch that was used for GT v KKR. This pitch suits the home team who are now seam-heavy. Bit of grass, which has freshness. Spinners might get a bit of assistance. Red soil pitch.
We are looking to bowl. Boult is coming in place of Jason Holder. Padikkal is playing when we bat, I am not sure. We'll keep learning about it (impact sub). I'd like to score some runs today.

It has been a belter so far. It's a good toss to lose, don't mind bating or bowling first. For us, it's important how we use it (impact player). We'll use it only when required. Forced change, Vijay Shankar isn't playing. Abhinav comes in for him. It's my home state, lot of love, everyone comes here and supports us, exciting.
(Playing XI): Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Sanju Samson(w/c), Riyan Parag, Shimron Hetmyer, Dhruv Jurel, Ravichandran Ashwin, Trent Boult, Adam Zampa, Sandeep Sharma, Yuzvendra Chahal
(Playing XI): Wriddhiman Saha(w), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya(c), Abhinav Manohar, David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Rashid Khan, Alzarri Joseph, Mohammed Shami, Mohit Sharma
Joshua Little, Jayant Yadav, Noor Ahmad, Srikar Bharat, Dasun Shanaka
Devdutt Padikkal, Murugan Ashwin, Donavon Ferreira, Navdeep Saini, Joe Root

The players make their way out to the middle. RR have only five specialist bowlers which includes three spinners. Boult has the new ball in his hand. Can he get some swing? A slip in place. Off we go...
Boult to Saha, , 129.7kph, gets the ball to swing in but Boult errs with his line - down leg
Boult to Saha, no run, 135kph, this one goes away with the angle. Decent bounce as well from a good length. Saha is stuck in his crease as he looks to push at it. Beaten on the outside edge!
Boult to Saha, , 135.7kph, Saha is underway! Full toss swinging in on middle and leg, easy pickings for Saha who flicks it away through mid-wicket
Boult to Saha,  Caught&Bowled!!

Boult to Saha,  Caught&Bowled!! Boult strikes early, again! Length delivery, swinging in on middle and leg, Saha is early to close his bat-face and gets a fat leading edge that goes a mile up in the air. Three fielders - point, keeper and mid-wicket - converge and all three go for the catch despite the keeper calling for it. There's a collision as well between the two. Samson fails to gather it because of that. But fortunately for him, the ball pops up and goes into the hands of Boult who was only watching and hoping for someone else to drop. Dramatic!
Boult to Sai Sudharsan, 1 run, fullish delivery swinging away, pushed towards extra cover off the outer edge
Boult to Shubman Gill, no run, curls in from a short of a good length, blunted into the on-side
Boult to Shubman Gill, no run, fuller and Boult gets it to swing in, defended back to Boult
Sandeep Sharma to Sai Sudharsan, no run, seams away a bit from a length, Sai Sudharsan defends from the crease
Sandeep Sharma to Sai Sudharsan, no run, short of length ball, turned to mid-wicket
Sandeep Sharma to Sai Sudharsan, , width served and Sai Sudharsan latches onto it. The length was on the shorter side as well. The left-hander waits on the back foot and slaps the cut through point
Sandeep Sharma to Sai Sudharsan, 1 run, driven crisply and extra cover half-stops with a dive to his left. Mid-off tidies up but can't stop the single
Sandeep Sharma to Shubman Gill, no run, full and curling away a bit, pushed to mid-off
Sandeep Sharma to Shubman Gill, no run, full and curling away a bit, pushed to mid-off
Sandeep Sharma to Shubman Gill, no run, fullish delivery outside off, pushed to backward point
Boult to Sai Sudharsan, , 131.5kph, no swing and Boult spills this length ball down leg, past Sudharsan's flick

Boult to Sai Sudharsan, , 136.9kph, top shot! Pitched up by Boult, curls away slightly, but Sai Sudharsan is well-equipped to counter that. Gets forward and drives past the non-striker. No chance for mid-on to stop that

Boult to Sai Sudharsan, 1 run, full on the pads, Sudharsan is late on the flick, inside-edges to fine leg. The third umpire has summoned to check if it was a short run. Did Sudharsan have any part of the bat over the line? No! Just one run...
Boult to Sai Sudharsan, no run, full and swinging away outside off, defensively pushed to point
Boult to Sai Sudharsan, no run, 134.2kph, driven neatly off the front foot and in the direction of the swing but straight to the fielder at cover
Boult to Sai Sudharsan, 3 runs, 136.2kph, in the air and safe! Sai Sudharsan is early to clip but luckily it beat the diving mid-wicket fielder to his left

Boult to Shubman Gill, , 135.6kph, Shubman Gill gets off the mark with an authoritative stroke! Ample width served outside off, Gill stands tall and slaps it fiercely through extra cover. Bulleted away to the fence.
Sandeep Sharma to Sai Sudharsan, no run, 130.6kph, drives a full delivery straight to mid-off
Sandeep Sharma to Sai Sudharsan, no run, 129kph, Sandeep Sharma persists with the fuller length, wristily knocked to mid-on
Sandeep Sharma to Sai Sudharsan, no run, 126.4kph, Sandeep pulls his length back and that's been punched to mid-off
Sandeep Sharma to Sai Sudharsan, 1 run, 107.6kph, round the wicket, slower delivery, turned to square leg
Sandeep Sharma to Shubman Gill, 1 run, 126.2kph, driven along the carpet to long-on
Hardik is padded up with his helmet on...
Sandeep Sharma to Sai Sudharsan, 1 run, 109.6kph, slower delivery on a good length, turned to square leg
First bowling change. The two fielders in the deep - long-on and deep mid-wicket
Zampa to Sai Sudharsan, 2 runs, 89.2kph, Zampa starts with a short ball and that's been pulled away through mid-wicket. The man in the deep makes a sliding stop to his left
Zampa to Sai Sudharsan, 1 run, worked with the spin to mid-wicket
Zampa to Sai Sudharsan, 1 run, worked with the spin to mid-wicket
Zampa to Shubman Gill, 1 run, 91.6kph, flat ball from a short of length, tucked into the on-side. Mid-on runs across and makes a sliding stop
Zampa to Sai Sudharsan, no run, 90.2kph, flicked to square leg
Zampa to Sai Sudharsan, 1 run, 96.4kph, quicker one, hurriedly turned to mid-wicket and Sai Sudharsan wants the second but gets sent back
Zampa to Shubman Gill,  Run Out!!

Zampa to Shubman Gill,  Sai Sudharsan Run Out!! 94.6kph, Gill comes down the track and yorks himself. Jams it into the deck and the ball goes over the leaping bowler who got a hand on it. Oh wait, there's a run-out appeal. Samson is confident. And Sai Sudharsan is short. The ball was dribbling towards mid-on and Sudharsan was initially looking to get back into the crease at the bowler's end. Gill kept running and Sudharsan was late to take off for the single.
Ashwin to Shubman Gill, , Gill greets Ashwin with a boundary. Gets down on one leg, fetches this flat ball from outside off and sweeps fiercely over square leg. Superb shot
Ashwin to Shubman Gill, 1 run, 89.5kph, tucked into the mid-wicket pocket
Ashwin to Hardik Pandya, no run, 91.5kph, fired in on off and middle, blocked
There's a slip in place
Ashwin to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, 96.3kph, quicker delivery, knocked to long-on
Ashwin to Shubman Gill, no run, full on the pads, flicked straight to square leg
Ashwin to Shubman Gill, , 10 runs off Ashwin's first over! Shimmies down the track, moves slightly leg-side to open up the off-side, gets underneath this fullish ball and lifts it over mid-off
Zampa to Hardik Pandya, no run, 85.7kph, push-driven to wide mid-off off the front foot
Zampa to Hardik Pandya, , 93.2kph, full and drifting in, overpitched, Hardik Pandya clears his front leg and swings hard through the line over straight long-on
Zampa to Hardik Pandya, , four more! Zampa goes full again and Hardik Pandya thumps this over the bowler's head for a one-bounce head. No turn and Pandya pounced!
Zampa to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, 95.7kph, length ball, Pandya pushes it to cover off the front foot with an opened bat-face
Interesting to see how GT would tackle this spin trio. Their batsmen are very good against pacers but haven't been tested enough against quality spinners.
Zampa to Shubman Gill, 1 run, 94.1kph, eased through cover point off the front foot
Zampa to Shubman Gill, 1 run, 94.1kph, eased through cover point off the front foot
Zampa to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, 96.4kph, very full delivery, drifting in on leg, Hardik Pandya stays leg-side of the ball to drive to long-on
Ashwin to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, 96.8kph, flat offie, worked through wide mid-on

Ashwin to Shubman Gill, , excellent use of the feet. 91.4kph, carrom ball, Shubman Gill comes down the track, gets close to the pitch of the ball and superbly lifts it over extra cover. Couple of bounces and into the fence
Ashwin to Shubman Gill, 1 run, another carrom ball, slightly shorter and that's been knocked towards mid-on

Ashwin to Hardik Pandya, , 95.5kph, edged and four!  Carrom ball, Pandya stays leg-side of the ball to hammer it over mid-off/extra cover. Gets a fat outside edge that goes fine of the fielder at short third man
Ashwin to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, 92.8kph, cut away to sweeper cover
Ashwin to Shubman Gill, ,  96 kph, fuller in length, Shubman Gill dances down the track, gets to the pitch of this delivery, lofts it high and over straight long-on
40 runs off the last three overs. GT taking the attack to the Rajasthan spinners
Chahal to Hardik Pandya, no run, defensively pushed to point
Chahal to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, 83.7kph, loopy legbreak, too full to be cutting and Hardik Pandya gets an under-edge that rolls to short third man

Chahal to Shubman Gill, 3 runs, 84.5kph, Gill waits on the back foot and cuts with the spin to deep point. Hetmyer makes a good stop to his left saving a run. His leg was close to the rope but he didn't touch it when the ball was in his hand
Chahal to Hardik Pandya, no run, 87.4kph, flatter in trajectory, pushed to cover
Chahal to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, 85.5kph, non-turner, punched to long-on
Chahal to Shubman Gill, 1 run, 84.4kph, push-driven to long-off for a single. Just 6 runs off Chahal's opening over
Boult to Shubman Gill, 1 run, 129.7kph, round the wicket, full delivery outside off, driven uppishly to deep extra cover
Boult to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, 133.3kph, over the wicket, fuller than good length, Hardik Pandya plays with a straight bat. The ball hits the turf and bounces over Boult
Boult to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, 133.3kph, over the wicket, fuller than good length, Hardik Pandya plays with a straight bat. The ball hits the turf and bounces over Boult
Boult to Shubman Gill, 1 run, 122.6kph, pace off and shorter in length, pulled away to deep mid-wicket
Boult to Hardik Pandya, ,  Pace on, short ball, sits up nicely for Hardik Pandya who picks the length early. The skipper stands tall and pulls it powerfully in front of square on the leg-side
Boult to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, back of a length delivery, punched towards cover off the back foot
Boult to Shubman Gill, 2 runs, 133.8kph, round the wicket, short of length delivery, Shubman Gill drags the pull between long-on and deep mid-wicket for a couple more
Ashwin has already conceded 27 in 2 overs which is the highest amount of runs given by him in these 4 matches
Chahal to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, 85.7kph, comes down the track and drills to the right of long-on
Chahal to Shubman Gill, 1 run, 89.2kph, middle-stump line, clipped away to deep mid-wicket
Chahal to Hardik Pandya, , 75.4kph, slow through the air but it's drifting down leg, left alone by Hardik Pandya
Chahal to Hardik Pandya,  Caught!!

Chahal to Hardik Pandya,  Caught by Jaiswal!!  and punches the air in delight! Tossed up legbreak at 85.6kph, Hardik Pandya stays leg-side of the ball to loft it downtown. The ball, however, spins away and that results in a miscue. The GT skipper ends up slicing it in the air and Jaiswal holds onto the catch at extra cover after backpedalling. Pandya got a start but failed to convert it into a big one.
A slip in place
Chahal to Miller, 1 run, 86.4kph, pushed to cover for a quick single
Chahal to Shubman Gill, 1 run, very slow, teasing leggie and Shubman Gill is happy to just push it towards cover off the front foot
Chahal to Miller, 1 run, 85.7kph, bunted down to long-on for a single. Another good over from Chahal
Ashwin to Miller, 1 run, 95.9kph, quick and flat, Miller stays back and pushes it through cover point
Ashwin to Shubman Gill, 1 run, 96.1kph, flat again and attacking the sticks, Shubman Gill closes his bat-face to work it through mid-wicket
Umpire review!

Ashwin to Miller, no run, Ashwin is appealing for a catch at slip. Miller goes back to cut and gets an under-edge that hits the turf close to the batter's boot before going into the fielder's hands. "Ball is touching the ground," says the TV umpire. It was the carrom ball from Ashwin that spun in, Miller didn't pick it and almost could have chopped it on

Ashwin to Miller, no run, Ashwin is appealing for a catch at slip. Miller goes back to cut and gets an under-edge that hits the turf close to the batter's boot before going into the fielder's hands. "Ball is touching the ground," says the TV umpire. It was the carrom ball from Ashwin that spun in, Miller didn't pick it and almost could have chopped it on
Ashwin to Miller, 1 run, 96kph, drifting in on leg, clipped to deep mid-wicket
Ashwin to Shubman Gill, 1 run, 94.2kph, fired in on leg, Shubman Gill jogs down and works it into the mid-wicket pocket
Ashwin to Miller, 2 runs, 95.8kph, quick offie, turned towards square leg off the back foot and the batters come back for the second. 100 up for GT!
Two quiet overs from RR. Can they continue to exert the pressure?
Zampa to Shubman Gill, 1 run, shortish delivery, no spin, pulled away to deep square leg

Zampa to Miller, no run,  87.1kph, tossed up ball, Miller looks to clip it towards mid-on/mid-wicket and chips it straight back at the bowler. The ball might have held onto the pitch a bit. It was a dolly and Zampa dropped it! How costly will it be?
Zampa to Miller, no run, full delivery, driven to extra cover
Zampa to Miller, 1 run, Miller shimmies down and works it through square leg
Zampa to Shubman Gill, no run, jogs down and pushes it back to Zampa
Zampa to Shubman Gill, no run, Shubman Gill misses the sweep against a full delivery. There's an lbw appeal but it dies down pretty quickly as the ball would have missed leg
Ashwin to Miller, no run, tossed up delivery on off, Miller drives it to cover
Ashwin to Miller, 1 run, short ball on leg, Miller swipes it away to deep backward square leg. Was a loose ball, deserved to be put away to the fence
Ashwin to Shubman Gill, leg byes, 1 run, fired on leg, clips the batter's pads and rolls towards short fine leg
Ashwin to Miller, 1 run, fraction short on middle and leg, Miller nudges it to wide long-on for a single
Ashwin to Shubman Gill, 1 run, goes full and wide outside off, Shubman Gill was down the wicket, and he somehow manages to get at on it, keeping it out towards mid-off
Ashwin to Miller, 1 run, better comeback by Ashwin. A quicker one to end his spell as Miller works this into the pocket at mid-wicket for one
Chahal to Miller, 1 run, walks across in the crease and nudges it through the leg-side for a single
Chahal to Miller, 1 run, walks across in the crease and nudges it through the leg-side for a single
Chahal to Shubman Gill, 1 run, fraction short on middle and leg, Shubman Gill whips it through mid-wicket for a single

Chahal to Miller, , Miller shimmies down the wicket and spanks this towards long-on. Buttler in the deep sprints to his right, puts in a dive, but this ball was struck so hard, there was no chance to get there
Chahal to Miller, 2 runs, clipped through the leg-side for a couple of runs
Chahal to Miller, 1 run, short ball outside off, Miller punches it to cover where the fielder stops it with a dive to his left
Chahal to Shubman Gill, 1 run, short and wide outside off, Shubman Gill chops it through point for a single
Sandeep Sharma to Shubman Gill, 2 runs, short of a length around off, hammered towards long-on by Shubman Gill, a couple of runs as the fielder does well to stop this in the deep
Sandeep Sharma to Shubman Gill,  Caught!!

Sandeep Sharma to Shubman Gill,  Caught by Buttler!! No fifty for Gill tonight! This was pitched up by Sandeep Sharma around off, and Shubman Gill tries to take him on. Hits this hard towards long-off, but doesn't get the elevation. Buttler stationed near the boundary takes a nonchalant catch and he doesn't even bother celebrating..
GT have a few batters left, but will they be able to strike big towards the end? Let's find out..
Sandeep Sharma to Abhinav Manohar, 1 run, length ball around off, Abhinav Manohar knocks it to long-off for a single
Sandeep Sharma to Miller, 1 run, on a length around middle and leg, clipped through the leg-side for a single
Sandeep Sharma to Abhinav Manohar, 1 run, eased down to long-off by Abhinav Manohar for a single
Sandeep Sharma to Miller, 1 run, touch fuller on off, Miller chips this towards long-off for a single
Chahal to Miller, 1 run, widish delivery outside off, Miller slashes away from his body, gets an outside edge towards short third man, stopped by the fielder stationed inside the ring
Chahal to Abhinav Manohar, 1 run, quicker through the air, Abhinav Manohar clips this through backward square leg
Chahal to Miller, 1 run, way too short on middle and leg, Miller drags this through square leg for a single
Chahal to Miller, 1 run, way too short on middle and leg, Miller drags this through square leg for a single
"We want sixer," is what the crowd is demanding
Chahal to Abhinav Manohar, 1 run, short outside off, Abhinav Manohar carves this to backward point for a single
Chahal to Miller, 2 runs, short and wide outside off, slapped through the off-side for a couple of runs

Chahal to Miller, , Killer Miller has arrived. A tossed up delivery by Chahal and Miller clubs this over deep mid-wicket for half-a-dozen. With one more over of spin to go, GT have a chance to score big with Miller still out there
Padikkal - IN, Chahal - OUT
Boult to Abhinav Manohar, 1 run, hooks this short ball over square leg for a single
Boult to Miller, 1 run, low full toss on middle and leg, a yorker attempted, Miller drills it to long-on for a single
Boult to Abhinav Manohar, ,  Rocks back in the crease, gets into position and clubs it over long-on for a massive 85 metre six. Boult on the back foot
Boult to Abhinav Manohar, ,  A low full toss on off and Abhinav Manohar has pummeled it over long-off for back-to-back sixes
Boult to Abhinav Manohar, 2 runs, short one by Boult and Manhar hooks it to deep backward square leg, stopped brilliantly by Padikkal near the boundary
Boult to Abhinav Manohar, 1 run, lofted towards long-on by Abhinav Manohar. End of an expensive over by Boult, in fact an expensive spell. Goes for 46 runs!
Zampa to Abhinav Manohar, no run, quicker through the air on middle and leg, Abhinav Manohar mistimes his punch back to the bowler
Zampa to Abhinav Manohar, 1 run, pitched up by the bowler on off, Abhinav Manohar drives it along the carpet to long-off
Zampa to Miller, , rocks back in the crease and hammers the pull towards deep mid-wicket for four runs
Zampa to Miller, 1 run, fraction short on off, Miller drags it to long-on for a single
Zampa to Abhinav Manohar, , tossed up delivery by Zampa, right into the slot, Abhinav Manohar stands tall and launches it over long-on for an 89 metre six. High and handsome, almost out of the park!
Zampa to Abhinav Manohar,  Caught!!
Zampa to Abhinav Manohar,  Caught!!

Zampa to Abhinav Manohar,  Caught by Padikkal!! Zampa has the last laugh! Goes full and wide outside off, Abhinav Manohar looks to go big against Zampa again and ends up slicing it towards point. No timing whatsoever and it's an easy catch for Padikkal.
Sandeep Sharma to Miller, , doesn't want to bowl this in Miller's arc, so he goes wide outside off, but misses the tramline too
Sandeep Sharma to Miller, no run, wide yorker outside off, but just inside the tramline this time around
Sandeep Sharma to Miller, , Sandeep Sharma goes full outside off, Miller goes deep inside the crease and spanks it over cover for four runs. Struck that really hard
Sandeep Sharma to Miller, , back-to-back boundaries. Full and wide outside off, Miller throws his hands at it, gets a thick outside edge that flies past short third man
Sandeep Sharma to Miller,  Caught!!

Sandeep Sharma to Miller,  Caught by Hetmyer!! End of Miller's pyrotechnics. A low full toss outside off, Miller throws the kitchen sink at it, miscues it towards deep cover and Hetmyer stationed near the fence takes it. Misses out on his fifty by a boundary.
Sandeep Sharma to Rashid Khan,  Run Out!!

Sandeep Sharma to Rashid Khan,  Rashid Khan Run Out!! 1 run completed. Rashid has slapped this short ball towards long-on and he initially called for two. The fielder from the deep does well though as he fires in a flat throw at the bowler's end. Rashid tries to get back in, but the bowler whips off the bails in a flash. Rashid's bat was on the line, and he's run-out by a whisker.
Sandeep Sharma to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, a low full toss on off, Tewatia drives it towards mid-off and it's just a single to end the innings.

Gujarat Titans end with a pretty challenging total, but Rajasthan Royals have a powerful batting line-up too. Talking about Gujarat's innings, they lost an early wicket in the form of Saha, but the Titans steadied the ship thereafter. Sudharsan was run-out by Buttler, but Pandya and Gill had a fine partnership following that. Gill missed out on his fifty as he was caught at long-off against Sandeep Sharma. Miller who was dropped by Zampa early in his innings went on to score 46 runs as well. Abhinav Manohar struck a few big sixes as well. Sandeep Sharma was the pick of the bowlers as he took a couple of wickets and conceded only 25 runs. Will RR manage to chase it down? Join us back in 10 minutes to find that out..

There's a lot of dew, it was tough to hold and grip the ball towards the end as the ball was wet. Last time, I won the purple cap, I am focussing on the trophy this year. Zampa bowled well in the last game and he had a good match-up against Miller. Holder is unwell and hence we picked Zampa. It's difficult to bowl at the death (for spinners). It's isn't easy to score if the boundary size if big and if there's some turn. This a very good batting wicket and dew is also a plus point for us. Hopefully we will chase this.
Welcome back for the run chase folks! The Gujarat players are out in the middle and so are the Rajasthan openers. Can Buttler and Jaiswal get the Royals off to another quick start? Let's find out..
Shami to Jaiswal, , short ball outside off, way too wide though
Shami to Jaiswal, no run, on a length outside off, shapes away a touch, Jaiswal goes for a drive, gets beaten
Shami to Jaiswal, no run, 140.2kph, full and quick on middle and leg, driven to mid-on by Jaiswal
Shami to Jaiswal, no run, short and wide outside off, Jaiswal cuts it hard, but straight to point

Shami to Jaiswal, 1 run, banged in short by Shami, Jaiswal goes for a pull, gets hurried due to the pace and the top edge eludes the fielder at wide mid-on. Mohit Sharma is quick to gather the ball and get rid of it
Shami to Buttler, no run, 142.8 kph, this ball swings in sharply and strikes the batter on the pads. Shami appeals for an lbw, but goes no response from the umpire
Shami to Buttler, no run, short of a length around middle and leg, Buttler gets an inside edge towards the leg-side, as he tries to punch it on the rise. Shami concedes only 2 runs
Hardik Pandya to Jaiswal, no run, pitched up by Hardik Pandya outside off, shapes away, Jaiswal goes for a drive, gets beaten beaten
Probably two best bowling attacks of the season. Should be a tight game.
Hardik Pandya to Jaiswal, no run, short of a length outside off, Jaiswal gets beaten on his cut
Hardik Pandya to Jaiswal,  Caught!!

Hardik Pandya to Jaiswal,  Caught by Shubman Gill!!  Short and quick outside off, some extra bounce on offer. This was angled across and Jaiswal has a poke at it. A regulation outside edge is induced and Gill at slip takes a comfortable catch. All-rounder Hardik in action tonight!
Hardik Pandya to Padikkal, no run, outside off, Padikkal gets beaten on the first ball
Hardik Pandya to Padikkal, no run, outside off, Padikkal gets beaten on the first ball
Hardik Pandya to Padikkal, no run, full and wide outside off, Padikkal tries to flirt with it, makes no contact though
Hardik Pandya to Padikkal, 1 run, this one swings back in sharply and Padikkal gets an outside edge towards third man, takes a single
Shami to Padikkal, no run, short of a length outside off, curving away, Padikkal has a poke and almost nicks it behind
Shami to Padikkal, leg byes, 1 run, this one shapes back in, strikes the pads really high and lobs towards the off-side, a leg bye taken
Shami to Buttler, no run, swings hard, and gets hit on the thigh pad
Shami to Buttler, no run, rides the bounce, carves it towards the off-side does Buttler
Shami to Buttler,  Bowled!!

Shami to Buttler,  Bowled!!  This one swings in sharply and Buttler looks to scoop this towards the leg-side. Gets beaten comprehensively due to the movement and the off-stump has been rattled. Shami pumps the air as he is delighted. Royals in trouble having lost both their openers so early! Not a familiar territory for them.
STAT: Second duck for Buttler in the IPL. The first had come on his debut: vs RPS (Mumbai WS, 2016)
Shami to Samson, no run, back of a length on middle and leg, nudged towards mid-on
Hardik Pandya to Padikkal, , drifting on the pads and Padikkal has flicked it uppishly over mid-wicket for the first boundary of the innings
Hardik Pandya to Padikkal, 1 run, short of a length outside off, Padikkal steers it away to square third man for a single
Hardik Pandya to Samson, no run, full and wide outside off, swinging away from the batter, Samson goes for a drive, gets beaten
Hardik Pandya to Samson, no run, on a length around off, Samson blocks it from within the crease
Hardik Pandya to Samson, no run, short ball outside off, some good carry, Samson leaves it alone
Hardik Pandya to Samson, , fantastic timing! Short of a length outside off, Samson times his cut through backward point as the ball races away to the fence at the rate of knots
Shami to Padikkal, no run, short of a length outside off, shaping away from the batter, Padikkal has a poke and gets beaten
Shami to Padikkal, no run, short and quick on off, Padikkal rides the bounce and taps it to point
Shami to Padikkal, no run, short and quick on off, Padikkal rides the bounce and taps it to point

Shami to Padikkal, no run, the ball is making the batters dance. Shami is making them dance to their tunes. Padikkal makes room to play this one, but Shami hits the deck and the ball curves back in sharply, Padikkal swings and misses
Shami to Padikkal, no run, and this one goes the other way round. Curves away from the batter from a shorter length and Padikkal gets beaten on his flashy cut
Shami to Padikkal, ,  Shami errs in line, drifts on the batter's pads and Padikkal has flicked it away with ease over deep backward square leg
Good to see Hardik hurrying his team to take their fielding positions between the overs and fall of wickets.

Shami to Padikkal, 1 run,  Slashes away from his body outside off, and gets a thick outside edge. Flies quickly to Gill who gets his hands to it, but fails to latch on to it. Think Gill has injured himself while attempting that catch, he has walked off the field with the physio
Hardik Pandya to Padikkal, no run, back of a length around off, Padikkal defends
Hardik Pandya to Padikkal, no run, Hardik Pandya goes short and Padikkal mistimes his pull towards mid-on
Hardik Pandya to Padikkal, no run, cramped for room on this occasion, Padikkal nudges it to mid-on
Hardik Pandya to Padikkal, , on a length outside off, Padikkal latches on to it and launches it over wide long-off for a clean six. No respect shown to the opposition skipper whatsoever
Hardik Pandya to Padikkal, no run, short of a length around off, Padikkal stays put and defends
Hardik Pandya to Padikkal, no run,  ends his over with a bouncer and Padikkal sways away
This is the bowling of highest quality, very rare that we are witnessing this in T20 cricket.. INCREDIBLE SWING BOWLING....
Suddenly the pitch of Ahmedabad  became pitch of Lord's while Shami was bowling
Alzarri Joseph to Samson, no run, , short of a length outside off, sharp carry as Samson gets beaten on his cut
Alzarri Joseph to Samson, ,  Short and quick at the hips, Samson stands tall and swipes it over deep square leg for a well-timed six. No fast bowler likes that. The comeback better be a good one
Alzarri Joseph to Samson, no run,  hits the deck on a length as Samson knocks it firmly to mid-on
Alzarri Joseph to Samson, 1 run, short of a length on middle and leg, pats this to mid-on and scampers across to the other end
Alzarri Joseph to Padikkal, , on a length outside off, Padikkal stays put and lofts this over the infield at cover. This one almost goes the distance
Alzarri Joseph to Padikkal, , on a length outside off, Padikkal stays put and lofts this over the infield at cover. This one almost goes the distance
Alzarri Joseph to Padikkal, 1 run, shorter ball outside off, slapped through cover-point by Padikkal
Hardik Pandya to Padikkal, 1 run, good length onto the pads, turned towards deep square leg.
Hardik was looking a bit jaded by the end of last over but he is bowling out here. Could be a big over!
Hardik Pandya to Samson, 1 run, good length angling onto leg, clipped towards deep mid-wicket
Hardik Pandya to Padikkal, 1 run, back of length onto middle, pulled along the ground towards deep backward square leg
ICYMI, GT have still not chosen their impact player. They could also go for an overseas player because they started with just three
Review taken for LBW by Gujarat. No bat for sure. Hits Samson on the knee roll but the angle could have taken the ball down leg. Yes, too much movement and goes down leg
Hardik Pandya to Samson, no run, GT burn a review!! This was pitched fuller and angles in sharply to get Samson on the knee roll. But the ball was doing too much and going down leg
Hardik Pandya to Samson, , What a shot!! That's some reply from Sanju Samson. On a length and slightly wider, Samson with a checked drive between extra cover and mid-off. Races away for four...
Hardik Pandya to Samson, 1 run, good length onto leg, turned towards deep mid-wicket

Two contrasting tactics on show today as RR went with three frontline spinners while GT are yet to even introduce spin. At the moment, it looks like Hardik Pandya got a better reading of the pitch, because it has been swinging like it is an overcast day in England. Rajasthan have absorbed the powerplay pressure, and Samson has looked really mature so far in his innings. Crucial few overs coming up...
Rashid Khan to Samson, 1 run, short outside off, no turn. Slapped towards the sweeper
Rashid Khan to Padikkal, no run, pushed quicker onto leg. Padikkal defends to the left of Rashid and he's quick to get to the ball
Rashid Khan to Padikkal,  Caught!!

Rashid Khan to Padikkal,  Caught by Mohit Sharma!! Wicket straight away for Rashid. Padikkal decided this was the over to target, and charged out to the spinner's googly to play a big heave. Gets a leading edge and Mohit Sharma at short third makes no mistake.
Rashid Khan to Riyan Parag, 1 run, fuller on the pads, turned towards deep mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to Samson, 1 run, onto the pads again, Samson clips towards deep mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to Samson, 1 run, onto the pads again, Samson clips towards deep mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to Riyan Parag, 1 run, shorter length turning into leg, punched towards deep mid-wicket off the backfoot
Big innings also for Riyan Parag. Can this be the match where he repays the faith RR have been having in him all these years?
Mohit Sharma to Riyan Parag, no run, good length outside off and zips through. Parag goes for a cut but the ball goes over his bat
Mohit Sharma to Riyan Parag, 1 run, on a length closer to off, punched to the left of Pandya at covers for a single
Mohit Sharma to Samson, no run, good length and straight line, punched towards mid-off
Mohit Sharma to Samson, no run, nice tight line on off from Mohit Sharma. Samson can only push towards mid-off
A Sanju special is long due.
Mohit Sharma to Samson, 1 run, good length wicket to wicket bowling, Samson backed away to punch towards the sweeper
Mohit Sharma to Riyan Parag, 1 run, length ball onto the pads, turned towards deep mid-wicket.
Rashid Khan to Riyan Parag, 1 run, goggly from a length, Parag shimmies inwards to turn towards deep backward square leg
Rashid Khan to Samson, 1 run, another googly, Samson goes onto the backfoot and waits for the turn, then pushes towards mid-on
Rashid Khan to Riyan Parag,  Caught!!

Rashid Khan to Riyan Parag,  Caught by Miller!! Gone!! Riyan Parag had to go for the big shot, this was a quick leg spinner leaving the batter. Parag went for a flashy drive down the ground - goes hard and flat towards long-off and Miller takes a nice catch as the ball was dying on him.
Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, no run, googly from middle stump, Hetmyer defends to the leg side
Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, 1 run, flat delivery on middle, punched towards long-off

Rashid Khan to Samson, , OUT OF HERE!! Fraction short and turning into the pads, Samson goes back and hoists his pull deep into the stands beyond deep mid-wicket. He really needed one big shot to get going...
One more day, one more disappointment. Riyan Parag disaster continues. I don't understand when will RR move on...
Mohit Sharma to Hetmyer, no run, full and straight, blocked towards mid-off
Mohit Sharma to Hetmyer, no run, full and straight, blocked towards mid-off
Mohit Sharma to Hetmyer, no run, full and angling onto off, Hetmyer leans in to drive but towards extra cover

Mohit Sharma to Hetmyer, 1 run, length ball onto middle, Hetmyer got into a very awkward position and aimlessly skies his pull. Very lucky it lands in no man's land near mid-wicket with everyone on the boundary ropes...
Mohit Sharma to Samson, 1 run, good length on off, driven square of the wicket - just a single
Mohit Sharma to Hetmyer, 1 run, fraction short onto middle and rushes the batter who turns it towards deep mid-wicket
Mohit Sharma to Samson, 1 run, pushed a bit fuller and wider as Samson gave Mohit the charge. Driven past the bowler but long-off will cut it off.
GT get their Impact Player on.  comes on for his first IPL appearance. He replaces Gill
Rashid Khan to Samson, no run, flat delivery on off, defended into the pitch
Rashid Khan to Samson, , flat on off, Samson goes for the big shot and slaps it down the ground. Miller was hugging the ropes at long-off and jumps as high as possible, but the ball goes over...
Rashid Khan to Samson, , short, Samson rocks back and pulls it hard. Didn't get it off the middle but enough muscle behind it to clear the fielder at cow corner...
Rashid Khan to Samson, , hat-trick of sixes!! This was flat and too short, Samson rocks back and this time the pull is more convincing. In front of square and over wide long-on into the stands...
Rashid Khan to Samson, 1 run, zipped fuller on off, Samson drives towards deep point
Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, 1 run, full on the pads, turned to mid-on for a single.

Alzarri Joseph to Hetmyer, , once again the ball goes just over a jumping fielder. This was a slot ball on middle by Joseph. Hetmyer clears his leg for a heave through square leg - not off the middle but over Manohar's head for six
Alzarri Joseph to Hetmyer, 1 run, better, almost the perfect yorker. Dug out towards deep mid-wicket
Alzarri Joseph to Samson, 1 run, length ball onto middle, Samson drives hard but towards long-on
Alzarri Joseph to Hetmyer, , attempted yorker but ends as a low full toss. Hetmyer slogs it between deep mid-wicket and deep square. One bounce and four...
Alzarri Joseph to Hetmyer, 2 runs, short pitched delivery, pulled to the right of deep mid-wicket for a couple of runs
Alzarri Joseph to Hetmyer, 1 run, nice yorker again. Stabbed out towards mid-off for a quick single
Alzarri Joseph to Hetmyer, 1 run, nice yorker again. Stabbed out towards mid-off for a quick single
Here's the impact player - Noor Ahmad. He is pretty much an unknown commodity in the IPL, let's hope the RR analysts had enough videos to study him. Could be a big over
Noor Ahmad to Hetmyer, 1 run, flat delivery that comes in to the left-hander. Hetmyer punches towards long-on off the backfoot
Noor Ahmad to Samson, 1 run, flighted up just outside off, Samson pushes it to the right of Pandya at extra cover for a single.
Noor Ahmad to Hetmyer, 1 run, flighted up and turns in, Hetmyer gets a thick inside edge on the drive towards deep mid-wicket
Noor Ahmad to Samson, , SIX MORE!! This was tossed up outside off, spinning away. Samson slices his big drive slightly but still manages to get enough bat on it to go past long-off
Noor Ahmad to Samson, , Noor Ahmad misses his line, strays down leg and Samson flicks it to the right of short fine for a boundary
Noor Ahmad to Samson,  Caught!!

Noor Ahmad to Samson,  Caught by Miller!! Big moment, Samson was the only one looking like taking the game away. A rush of blood for him as he couldn't resist himself seeing the ball in his arc on off. Toe-ends his big drive and Miller from long-off runs in, keeps his eyes on the ball throughout and completes the catch. IB1$
Impact players is a great addition to IPL, gives more options to the teams

Alzarri Joseph to Hetmyer, 2 runs, slot ball on middle again, Hetmyer heaves it down the ground and just short and to the left of Miller at long-off. Does really well infact to get both hands behind the ball and stop the boundary

Alzarri Joseph to Hetmyer, , Oh dear. This one slips out Joseph's hand. A waist high full toss and Hetmyer was just getting his bat down to protect himself. The ball takes a leading edge at flies over third-man for a six. Given no ball by the umpire but challenged by Pandya, replays show Hetmyer was out his crease and the ball would have just ended below waist. Strangely, Shami was standing well in front of the boundary rope. He didn't even jump and the ball just cleared the ropes...
Alzarri Joseph to Hetmyer, 1 run, good length onto leg, Hetmyer was backing away and can only tap it leg side for a single

Alzarri Joseph to Dhruv Jurel, , lovely!! A touch of class from the youngster playing his first ball. good length ball that shoots onto off, Jurel shuffles in and gives it a late dab to run it down between keeper and short third.
Alzarri Joseph to Dhruv Jurel, 1 run, short pitched, Jurel pulls a tad uppishly but on the bounce towards deep square

Alzarri Joseph to Hetmyer, , smoked!! The sound was so sweet that we knew it was six straight away. Attempted yorker from Joseph which lands short of his mark. Hetmyer gets under and hammers his drive over long-on into the stands.

We all need a breather now, don't we? What a fightback this has been from RR. Samson with a fifty of the highest quality, but then falls to the impact player. Hetmyer is still there and seeing them nicely, and Jurel has looked positive too in the couple of balls he has faced. One big over either side decides the game from here... you wouldn't want to miss this finish!!

Noor Ahmad to Dhruv Jurel, , flighted up but very wide outside off. Jurel goes chasing and drives it square. Looked like just a couple as Rashid ran in from sweeper and dived onto the ball. He stopped the ball but it deflects off his body into the fence...

Noor Ahmad to Dhruv Jurel, , flighted up but very wide outside off. Jurel goes chasing and drives it square. Looked like just a couple as Rashid ran in from sweeper and dived onto the ball. He stopped the ball but it deflects off his body into the fence...
Noor Ahmad to Dhruv Jurel, no run, full on leg, Jurel tries to sweep but can't connect
Noor Ahmad to Dhruv Jurel, no run, short and spinning away outside off. Jurel tries to cut but can't connect again. Two dots!!
Appeal for run-out. If this is out, Hetmyer will be the man gone. Agonizing watching the slow motion replay... but Hetmyer gets there!!
Noor Ahmad to Dhruv Jurel, 1 run, flat delivery that turned away from leg. Deflects off the thigh pad towards short fine for a single.
Noor Ahmad to Hetmyer, , full and spinning away from the batter at pace. Too wide and the umpire calls it
Noor Ahmad to Hetmyer, 1 run, flat and this one spun in. Clipped towards deep square for a single
Noor Ahmad to Dhruv Jurel, 1 run, flighted up, driven a tad uppishly towards Miller at long-off. Just a single
Rashid Khan to Dhruv Jurel, 1 run, half tracker that was spinning in. Jurel stepped out early and had to adjust to pull it behind square. Just a single
Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, no run, googly going just outside off, Hetmyer punches off the backfoot but straight towards Pandya at covers
Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, , bad ball, straying onto leg and Hetmyer pulls it to the right of short fine for a boundary!!
Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, no run, googly that spun in from outside leg to get Hetmyer on the back thigh pad. He was through the shot early
Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, , what a cat and mouse game here!! Rashid gives it some flight, Hetmyer steps out to the pitch - gets under it and slams over long-on. What a valuable six...
Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, 2 runs, googly going outside off, punched to the left of deep extra for a couple of runs.

Shami to Dhruv Jurel, , Dhruv Jurel, take a bow!! Shami has figures of 1/9 so far and he was scary with that swing. But first ball in the death is a half volley onto leg, still had to be put away and Jurel whacks it over long-on.
Shami to Dhruv Jurel,  Caught!!

Shami to Dhruv Jurel,  Caught by Mohit Sharma!! What a riveting match this has been!! Shami goes bouncer this time, Jurel isn't afraid to play the hook but this time top-edges and Mohit Sharma from fine leg runs in to complete the catch. So many twists in this game, Abbas Mustan couldn't have written such a script...
Shami to Ashwin, , another twist!! Back of length outside off, Ashwin stays deep in his crease and cuts it behind square on the off side. Four more...
Shami to Ashwin, , another twist!! Back of length outside off, Ashwin stays deep in his crease and cuts it behind square on the off side. Four more...
Shami to Ashwin, , wow! Short pitched and Ashwin was ready. Very deep in his crease and pulled over deep mid-wicket. Just over the boundary ropes, but they still count as six...
Shami to Ashwin, , wow! Short pitched and Ashwin was ready. Very deep in his crease and pulled over deep mid-wicket. Just over the boundary ropes, but they still count as six...
Shami to Ashwin,  Caught!!
Shami to Ashwin,  Caught!!

Shami to Ashwin,  Caught by Rahul Tewatia!! Jesus, how many more twists are we going to get. This was actually the worst ball of the over. It was full outside off, there to be hit but Ashwin slices his drive down the throat of Tewatia at backward point. Madness!!

Shami to Ashwin,  Caught by Rahul Tewatia!! Jesus, how many more twists are we going to get. This was actually the worst ball of the over. It was full outside off, there to be hit but Ashwin slices his drive down the throat of Tewatia at backward point. Madness!!
Shami to Boult, no run, yorker that goes between stumps and a backing away Boult. Swing and a miss...
Shami to Boult, no run, yorker that goes between stumps and a backing away Boult. Swing and a miss...
This Shami over deserves a web series in itself, every ball had so much drama!!
This Shami over deserves a web series in itself, every ball had so much drama!!
Noor Ahmad for the last over. What a big gamble by Pandya.
Noor Ahmad for the last over. What a big gamble by Pandya.
Noor Ahmad to Hetmyer, 2 runs, short and wide, cut square of the wicket. Slightly to the right of Rashid and his throw is too wide. Allows Hetmyer to come back.
Noor Ahmad to Hetmyer, 2 runs, short and wide, cut square of the wicket. Slightly to the right of Rashid and his throw is too wide. Allows Hetmyer to come back.

Noor Ahmad to Hetmyer, , He's done it!! Take a bow Shimron Hetmyer, punches the air and yelps in delight. Too short by Noor Ahmad, allows Hetmyer to go back and slam his pull over cow corner. A flat six, over a region where there was no deep fielder... What a sensational chase by Rajasthan!!

Noor Ahmad to Hetmyer, , He's done it!! Take a bow Shimron Hetmyer, punches the air and yelps in delight. Too short by Noor Ahmad, allows Hetmyer to go back and slam his pull over cow corner. A flat six, over a region where there was no deep fielder... What a sensational chase by Rajasthan!!

These two teams are ranked first and third on the points table, and they were the finalists last season. Today's game shows us exactly why. One of those games where you have to write the cliche 'cricket is the real winner.' Stunning game at Ahmedabad, it was a boxing contest between two heavyweights - punch and counter punch and ultimately Hetmyer delivered the knockout blow. This chase started with a sensational display of swing bowling, as temporarily we were transported to Lord's on an overcast morning thanks to Pandya and Shami. They picked up Jaiswal and Buttler for a cumulative score of one run.

This chase started with a sensational display of swing bowling, as temporarily we were transported to Lord's on an overcast morning thanks to Pandya and Shami. They picked up Jaiswal and Buttler for a cumulative score of one run.

RR counter-attacked with Padikkal who struck a few sixes in the powerplay, but he fell to Rashid shortly after the time-out. Riyan Parag had another forgettable day with the bat, but skipper Sanju Samson stood tall. He took on the main wicket-taker Rashid and came out smiling, as he smashed three consecutive sixes off him. Shimron Hetmyer at the other end augmented his reputation as a finisher by taking on Alzarri Joseph. GT threw a curve ball in the form of mystery spinner Noor Ahmad, and the impact sub got the wicket of Samson. But RR were relentless in their fight, as Dhruv Jurel and Hetmyer never let the momentum drop. Then came Shami's final over, where literally every ball told a story in itself. Ultimately, the equation was down to 7 off the last over and Hetmyer smoked one over cow corner to ensure RR finally get the better of Gujarat. Why Mohit Sharma bowled just two overs after conceding just seven runs will remain a mystery...

To be honest no (didn't expect the loss after the powerplay), but that's the beauty about this game. The game is never over till it's over, another lesson for us. (Noor Ahmad) He's someone who's difficult to pick, got us the big breakthrough but the other bowlers didn't execute. Body is good, everything is good. It's a very long tournament. A lot of matches left, we still need to play a lot of group cricket even if we had won today. (On Gujarat's score) I felt short. After I got out, they bowled a couple of good overs, but we should have gone a little harder and got to 200. We did cover it well but when I was watching from outside, I did feel that we were 10 runs maybe short.

(Noor Ahmad) He's someone who's difficult to pick, got us the big breakthrough but the other bowlers didn't execute. Body is good, everything is good. It's a very long tournament. A lot of matches left, we still need to play a lot of group cricket even if we had won today. (On Gujarat's score) I felt short. After I got out, they bowled a couple of good overs, but we should have gone a little harder and got to 200. We did cover it well but when I was watching from outside, I did feel that we were 10 runs maybe short.

It got a little tensed in the end, especially when the match went down to the wire, but we had the batter out there who could finish it off. We had to keep the scoreboard ticking, and we made sure to get that odd-boundary. It was moving around a but in the first few overs, but thankfully we got through those overs. It's unbelievable how he (Hetmyer) does such things, such a great talent to have in our side.

We had to keep the scoreboard ticking, and we made sure to get that odd-boundary. It was moving around a but in the first few overs, but thankfully we got through those overs. It's unbelievable how he (Hetmyer) does such things, such a great talent to have in our side.

When you play quality opponents on a quality wicket, you get such games. Very happy to compete in such a game and come out on top. It was important to rotate our bowlers, they were playing some quality cricket and we had to respect that. The whole team came up well today and we could restrict them to around 170. The start we had, it shows how good a wicket this was. The new ball the quality of swing bowling was good and we had to respect that. But today Zampa coming was a way to match-up with the opponents. He was the match-up for Miller and almost got the wicket, but the catch was dropped. (On Hetmyer) He doesn't like easy situations, we like putting him in such situations because he usually wins us games from such situations.

When you play quality opponents on a quality wicket, you get such games. Very happy to compete in such a game and come out on top. He was the match-up for Miller and almost got the wicket, but the catch was dropped. (On Hetmyer) He doesn't like easy situations, we like putting him in such situations because he usually wins us games from such situations.

I don't have any words. Difficult to win against these guys, they beat us thrice last year but today was sort of a revenge. I practise these situations, it helps when you practise with that mindset of knowing we are few wickets down and chasing 100 with 8 overs to go. (On Noor Ahmad bowling the final over) I was actually pretty happy to be honest, he bowled well throughout so the first ball all I was thinking about was getting that double and take it from there.

The final of 2022 was a pretty drub affair, but this game today more than compensates for it. Cricket of the highest quality played between two opponents who matched each other stride for stride. Ultimately, Rajasthan got over the line... It was a pleasure covering this game for y'all. May the IPL long produce such thrillers. On that thought, this is  signing off on behalf on and
